It is the duty of all of us to spend this short life breaking the heart, not breaking down the hearts but conquering the hearts.
Regardless of ethnicity, language, religion and worldview, everyone on this homeland is one and the same.
This holiday is not a certain holiday, it is a feast for everyone.
The Christians of this country as well as the Muslims live the same sentiment. As much as the present of this country, the Alevis are experiencing this common feeling.
Our ethnic origins, our mother tongue, our belief, our sect, our methods, our lifestyles and our sensitivities may be different.
We will approach each other with tolerance. We will walk in the future, not in humiliation of each other's lifestyles, but in respect.
We will build a floor where no one can humiliate anyone, and no one prefers to another.
76 million freedoms, values ​​and especially lifestyles are under our guarantee.
On this festive day, I ask my citizens once more to honor each other.
I expect a new attitude from the political parties and NGOs to further elevate the fraternity in this country and further strengthen our unity.

We have witnessed a different aspect of a very serious massacre that has continued in Egypt since the beginning of Ramadan.
We have also watched on world television that a massacre was very open to the people of Egypt who are in the struggle for democracy.
These people who believed in martyrdom; sooner or later they will win the fight for their democratic rights in Egypt.
If we can not feel the responsibility to act against these living people, our reason for our existence will be removed.
We will always tell the truth that we believe. Anyone who does not react to an injustice is a mute demon.
Somewhere in the world, I have not heard that while people are slaughtered, I mean to say that this murder is common.
The blood of those innocent children is infected with the hands of everyone who has been unresponsive.
In Syria we are stagnant, we are stagnant in Palestine and today you are also silent in Egypt.
In the past, no cruel persecution has ever happened. They know very well that Egypt did not remain in Pharaohs.
Sooner or later a Musa comes out and asks for the account of the persecution.
